title: Great Servants of the Lord in the Last Days
html:
This chapter highlights Isaiah’s skill as a poet, demonstrates his calling as a seer, and reveals the power of his prophetic call. Isaiah describes, in detail, significant events prior to the Second Coming, identifying at least two key figures who will play essential roles before the Savior’s return. Also, Isaiah prophesies of circumstances after the Savior’s arrival, giving us a brief vision of what life will be like during the Millennium.

When Moroni appeared to Joseph Smith on September 21, 1823, he quoted this chapter of Isaiah and explained that “it was about to be fulfilled” (Joseph Smith—History 1:40). Through study, pondering, and prayer, we can gain an understanding into this chapter’s importance for us as Latter-day Saints while we look for the signs of its fulfillment in these, the last days.
